com.act365.sudoku

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.act365.sudoku.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    A Grid object represents a partially-filled Su Doku grid.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int boxesAcross 
      (package private) int boxesDown 
      (package private) int cellsInRow 
      (package private) int complexity 
      (package private) byte[][] data 
      (package private) int nUnwinds 
      (package private) Solver solver 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid()
      Creates a dimensionless Su Doku grid.
      Grid(int boxesAcross, int boxesDown)
      Creates a Su Doku grid with the given number of boxes (aka subgrids) in each dimension.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object clone()
      Clones the grid.
      int countFilledCells()
      Counts the number of filled cells in the grid.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Tests for equality.
      (package private) Grid halfRotate()
      Rotates the grid through a half-turn.
      Grid populate(java.lang.String s)
      Populates the grid from a string.
      (package private) boolean precedes(Grid grid)
      Determines whether this grid precedes the given grid.
      (package private) Grid quarterRotate()
      Rotates the grid through a quarter-turn anticlockwise.
      (package private) Grid rearrangeData()
      Sets the contents of the given grid to be a rearranged form of this grid such that, when read from left-to-right and top-to-bottom, the numbers appear in increasing order.
      Grid rectify(boolean[][] mask)
      Reflects, rotates and rearranges the grid as necessary in order to reduce it to its lowest form.
      (package private) Grid reflectLeftRight()
      Reflects the grid data in the line that runs from the left centre of the grid to the right centre.
      (package private) Grid reflectTopBottom()
      Reflects the grid data in the line that runs from the top centre of the grid to the bottom centre.
      (package private) Grid reflectTopLeftBottomRight()
      Reflects the grid data in the diagonal that runs from the top-left corner of the grid to the bottom-right.
      (package private) Grid reflectTopRightBottomLeft()
      Reflects the grid data in the diagonal that runs from the top-right corner of the grid to the bottom-left.
      void reset()
      Resets the value of each grid square.
      void resize(int boxesAcross, int boxesDown)
      Sets the number of boxes in the Su Doku grid.
      Grid shuffle()
      Randomly shuffles the current grid.
      Grid shuffle(boolean rearrange, boolean rotate, boolean reflect) 
      int solve(IStrategy strategy, int maxSolns)
      Solves the grid.
      (package private) int solve(IStrategy strategy, IStrategy composeSolver, int maxSolns) 
      java.lang.String toString()
      Produces a string representation of the grid.
      java.lang.String toXML(int serial, java.lang.String grade)
      Writes the current grid with its associated labels in XML format to a string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int boxesAcross,
            int boxesDown)
        Creates a Su Doku grid with the given number of boxes (aka subgrids) in each dimension.

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        Creates a dimensionless Su Doku grid. The grid will have to be redimensioned before it stores a puzzle.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Clones the grid.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • resize

        public void resize(int boxesAcross,
                   int boxesDown)
        Sets the number of boxes in the Su Doku grid.

      • populate

        public Grid populate(java.lang.String s)
        Populates the grid from a string.
        Parameters:
        s - string in the format created by toString()

      • countFilledCells

        public int countFilledCells()
        Counts the number of filled cells in the grid.

      • solve

        public int solve(IStrategy strategy,
                 int maxSolns)
        Solves the grid.
        Parameters:
        strategy - strategy to be used
        maxSolns - the maximum number of solutions to be sought
        Returns:
        number of solutions found

      • solve

        int solve(IStrategy strategy,
          IStrategy composeSolver,
          int maxSolns)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the value of each grid square.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Produces a string representation of the grid.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Tests for equality.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • precedes

        boolean precedes(Grid grid)
        Determines whether this grid precedes the given grid. The value true will be returned if the two grids match.

      • halfRotate

        Grid halfRotate()
        Rotates the grid through a half-turn.

      • quarterRotate

        Grid quarterRotate()
        Rotates the grid through a quarter-turn anticlockwise. Nothing happens if the number of boxes across the grid does not match the number of boxes down.

      • reflectLeftRight

        Grid reflectLeftRight()
        Reflects the grid data in the line that runs from the left centre of the grid to the right centre.

      • reflectTopBottom

        Grid reflectTopBottom()
        Reflects the grid data in the line that runs from the top centre of the grid to the bottom centre.

      • reflectTopLeftBottomRight

        Grid reflectTopLeftBottomRight()
        Reflects the grid data in the diagonal that runs from the top-left corner of the grid to the bottom-right. Nothing happens if the number of boxes across the grid does not match the number of boxes down.

      • reflectTopRightBottomLeft

        Grid reflectTopRightBottomLeft()
        Reflects the grid data in the diagonal that runs from the top-right corner of the grid to the bottom-left. Nothing happens if the number of boxes across the grid does not match the number of boxes down.

      • rectify

        public Grid rectify(boolean[][] mask)
        Reflects, rotates and rearranges the grid as necessary in order to reduce it to its lowest form.

      • rearrangeData

        Grid rearrangeData()
        Sets the contents of the given grid to be a rearranged form of this grid such that, when read from left-to-right and top-to-bottom, the numbers appear in increasing order.

      • shuffle

        public Grid shuffle()
        Randomly shuffles the current grid.

      • shuffle

        public Grid shuffle(boolean rearrange,
                    boolean rotate,
                    boolean reflect)

      • toXML

        public java.lang.String toXML(int serial,
                              java.lang.String grade)
        Writes the current grid with its associated labels in XML format to a string.
